meta.name: Le Fabuleux Destin d'Amélie
meta.subtitle: French cinema warmth meets Japanese artisan soul. Montmartre bistros and Kojima ateliers in harmony.
meta.tagline: Where whimsy meets craft, and every piece tells a story.
meta.hero_quote: Amélie has a strange feeling of absolute harmony. It's a perfect moment. Soft light, a scent in the air, and the quiet life of a beautiful garment.

products.name: Le Gaspard Jumper
products.description: Morgane Sézalory's vision of Parisian romance made wool. Deep forest green—like the café walls in Amélie's world. Soft lambswool with a slightly oversized fit that drapes like you're walking through Montmartre at golden hour.

products.name: Gabin Dress
products.description: Jeanne Damas distilled French femininity into a dress. Wrap silhouette, floral red—the color of Amélie's cardigan, of café awnings, of love notes tucked into pockets. A dress that makes you want to write poetry.

products.name: Minquiers Moderne Breton Stripe
products.description: 21 white stripes + 20 navy stripes—Napoleon's 1858 decree for naval uniforms, each stripe representing a victory. Woven in Normandy since 1889. Coco Chanel saw sailors in this and made it fashion. History in every thread.

products.name: Amour Embroidered Sailor Tee
products.description: 'AMOUR' hand-embroidered in red thread across the heart. Classic Breton stripes reimagined with Parisian wit. Founded by two brothers who wanted to bring back the joy of monogrammed linens. Whimsy that doesn't try too hard.

products.name: Snap Cardigan
products.description: The snap cardigan that defined French cool since 1979. agnès b. replaced buttons with pressure snaps—a rebellion against fussiness. Every French woman owns one. Audrey Tautou wore similar in Amélie. Simple but not basic.

products.name: New Standard Jean
products.description: Jean Touitou's minimalist manifesto in denim. Japanese selvedge, Parisian cut. The New Standard is the most A.P.C. jean—medium rise, straight leg that tapers gently. Raw denim that tells your story as it fades.

products.name: French Work Pants (Unisex)
products.description: The pants Jill loved from Tim's gallery—now in her size. Vibrant bleu de travail, European workwear heritage filtered through Japanese precision. High rise, full thigh, elastic back. A Parisian cycling through cobblestones.

products.name: Women's G-Pant
products.description: Born in Yosemite climbing culture. The integrated webbing belt adjusts with one hand—designed for rock faces, perfect for life. Diamond gusseted crotch for full range of motion. Jill loved the men's; the women's fits her frame.

products.name: Umahide Indigo Work Pants
products.description: Poetry written in natural indigo. 45R has a Paris boutique where Japanese craft meets French appreciation. Umahide ('horse-leather') is their signature weave—durable, soft, evolving with wear. Each piece numbered.

products.name: Hakama Pants
products.description: Hiroki Nakamura's meditations on craft and tradition. Hakama silhouette—the flowing pants worn by samurai and kendo practitioners—rendered in contemporary cotton. A walking philosophy about beauty in utility.

products.name: Pernille Tapered Pants
products.description: Isabel Marant's Parisian bohemian vision. Relaxed through the thigh, tapered at ankle—the silhouette that bridges café terraces and gallery openings. Easy elegance that looks effortless (but isn't).

products.name: Fox Head Patch Cardigan
products.description: Founded in Paris by a French architect and a Japanese musician. The fox (kitsuné) bridges both cultures—playful in France, mythical in Japan. This cardigan is their manifesto: clean French lines with Tokyo attention to detail.

products.name: Sashiko Jacket
products.description: Sashiko stitching was born from necessity—peasants reinforcing worn cloth with running stitch. Blue Blue Japan elevates this to art. Each stitch by hand, each jacket one-of-a-kind. The poetry of repair.

products.name: Shimokita Smock Dress
products.description: From Kojima, Japan's denim capital. Kapital takes Americana and Japanese folk and blends them into something new. This smock dress—loose, layered, lived-in—is fashion as autobiography.

products.name: Croissant Bag - Small
products.description: Christophe Lemaire (former Hermès artistic director) designed this for his partner Sarah-Linh Tran. Named for the crescent shape—and yes, the French breakfast pastry. Soft, sculptural, utterly Parisian. The bag of the decade.

products.name: Eli Scarf
products.description: Navy cashmere—Jill's signature color in the most luxurious fiber. Sézane's Eli scarf is the one you throw on and forget you're wearing because it's that soft. For mornings in the Pacific Northwest and memories of Paris.

products.name: Genuine Work Jacket
products.description: The original French chore coat—bleu de travail woven in France since 1913. Workers wore these in factories and fields. The twill has a specific drape that synthetic reproductions never capture. History you can wear.
products.maker: Le Mont Saint Michel · France · Since 1913

products.name: Brigitte Ballet Flat
products.description: Rose Repetto made the first pair for her son, choreographer Roland Petit. Then Brigitte Bardot wore them in ...And God Created Woman. Now they're synonymous with French elegance. Soft lambskin that molds to your foot.

products.name: Veste Civile
products.description: Bleu de Paname revives forgotten French workwear—the garments worn by tradesmen, concierges, railway workers. 'Civile' is the civilian version of military jackets, refined for city life. Made entirely in France.

products.name: Charcoal Candle
products.description: The scent of Amélie's world—warm, complex, romantic. Charcoal and cedarwood with hints of amber. Burns for 60 hours, filling the room with bistro warmth. Pour yourself something warm and light this.

products.name: Baies Candle
products.description: The scent that every Parisian apartment carries. Roses and blackcurrant leaves—the garden of a Montmartre courtyard. Diptyque founders were painters who fell into fragrance. Art for the nose.

products.name: Iconic Henley
products.description: Petit Bateau invented the modern t-shirt in 1893—cutting down long underwear for freedom of movement. This henley is the foundation of French layering. Cotton so soft it's unfair.

products.name: Romance Blouse
products.description: Two sisters (soeur = sister) designing clothes for women who live like the dream version of their Instagram. Romantic without being twee. The kind of blouse that makes you want to write letters by hand.

products.name: The Ultimate Breton
products.description: Ines de la Fressange literally wrote the book on Parisian style. Her Breton is the definitive version—fitted just so, stripes that lay perfectly. The supermodel-turned-author who made being French look effortless.
products.maker: Ines de la Fressange · Paris, France

products.name: Silk Twill Scarf - Floral
products.description: French Trotters is the beloved concept store in the Marais. Their silk scarves—tied loosely around the neck or on a handbag—are the Parisian woman's secret weapon. Elevates everything instantly.

products.name: Dario Pleated Pants
products.description: Pierre Mahéo founded Officine Générale in the Marais with one mission: make the perfect basics. These pleated pants—wide through the thigh, tapered at the ankle—are the foundation of French ease.
